Threat: Skilled Hacker: replace users public key with his own for impersonation attacks
Countermeasure: Only the certificate servers, which are exclusively accessible from the internal network, have write access to the database; they provide an API to edit this table that requires knowledge of the user's password to use

Threat: Employees, Independent Contractors: physical access or abuse of access rights to modify public keys to impersonate a coworker
Countermeasure: Users will notice, because they will not be able to decrypt emails anymore nor use their private key for login
Additional Countermeasures: Notify users over an independent path (SMS or unencrypted email) about changes of critical data (password, public key).
